page.title: 19HEALTH
page.content: All employed persons pay National Health Contributions which entitles all the population to free treatment by doctor and hospital. Prescriptions cost 2 pounds per item unless patient is a child, o.a.p. or unemployed etc. Nearest hospitals for surgery are at Milton Keynes (12 miles), Aylesbury (18). Buckingham Cottage Hospital copes with short term, mainly elderly patients, consultations and clinics. Cancer is the most feared desease, although with early diagnosis is usua- lly curable - surgery is no longer the only answer. The population is mainly healthy; the air is unpolluted; they have enough to eat. Children are prone to colds and tummy upsets, chicken pox, German measles and occasionally mumps.
